name: Spicy Thai Tofu With Spinach, Basil, and Peanuts From 'Everyday Thai Cooking'
description: This simple stir-fry combines Thai staples—fish sauce, palm sugar, lime juice, and peanuts—with easy-to-find ingredients—spinach, tofu, basil—for a spicy, crunchy, vegetarian main that comes together faster than you can cook a pot of rice.
recipeIngredient: One 16-ounce (500 g) block ﬁrm tofu, drained, patted dry and cut into 1/2-inch (1.25 cm) cubes
1 tablespoon minced galangal or fresh ginger
8 ounces (250 g) spinach, washed and trimmed
2 teaspoons Asian chili sauce, preferably Sriracha
1/2 cup (10 g) ﬁnely chopped fresh Thai or Italian basil
1/3 cup (50 g) crushed roasted peanuts plus more for garnish
Fresh Thai or Italian basil leaves for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Heat half of the oil in a wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add the tofu pieces and stir-fry until golden brown, about 3 minutes. Remove from the pan and set aside.

Heat the remaining oil in the wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and galangal and stir-fry until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the spinach, ﬁsh sauce, sherry, oyster sauce, palm sugar, lime juice, and chili sauce; stir-fry until the spinach is wilted, about 2 minutes. Add the basil leaves and peanuts and stir-fry for 30 seconds until basil is wilted. Dish out and garnish with basil leaves and peanuts. Serve with jasmine rice.
